revised_title: The Impact of Bacterial Endotoxins on the Opsonizing Action of Rabbit Serum
tldr: This study investigates the effect of injecting intracellular bacterial constituents (endotoxins) on the opsonizing action of healthy rabbit serum. The results show that endotoxins can significantly alter the serum's ability to enhance the immune system's ability to recognize and eliminate bacteria. The research also compares the effects of different endotoxin doses and strains on the opsonizing action.
